instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chime loop wich battery
threads.message: This board works fully (in limp mode / 800MHz) when the battery is disconnected. When the battery is connected it chimes repeatedly, so at the end of the chime, it chimes again. A different battery produces the same result. Replaced <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, didn't help. Any thoughts? Could this be GPU related?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chime loop wich battery
threads.message:
Does it boot in SMC bypass with both charger and battery connected?
Check exact ohm resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chime loop wich battery
threads.message: Assuming you mean safe mode (holding shift), same behaviour. Both current sense circuits measured fine when I replaced the ISL.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chime loop wich battery
threads.message:
NO, I exactly mean SMC bypass mode; explained many times on the forum how to do it.
Google can help you, in case forum search not...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chime loop wich battery
threads.message: It won't let me do that, it starts instantly when I press the power button. Only thing I have left to try is corrupted BIOS maybe? Any other ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chime loop wich battery
threads.message:
"Check exact ohm resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>."

Did you try original battery, even old?
Do not try new battery from same batch...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chime loop wich battery
threads.message:
17/18:  3ohms
27/28: 20,9 ohms

Known good battery tested, same behaviour.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chime loop wich battery
threads.message: Does the board start on battery only (no charger)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chime loop wich battery
threads.message: Yes, it starts on only the (known good) battery. Same behaviour.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chime loop wich battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chime loop wich battery
threads.message: According to the customer it just started doing this, no specific history.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chime loop wich battery
threads.message:
Monitor <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_CHGR_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> levels.
Any sign of corrosion around SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chime loop wich battery
threads.message: Ok, I started testing for the suggestions above, but noticed the heatsink got hot real quick. Turns out phase 1 of the GPU is pulling ±35A from the start. GPU problem? I'm confused as to why that VR would even start at this point during POST/boot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chime loop wich battery
threads.message:
GPU should have the same behaviour for start sequence, w/ or w/o battery.
Check the mentioned sensors level and post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage with both battery and charger connected.
Is the battery charging?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chime loop wich battery
threads.message:
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TH]Measurement[/TH]
[TH]with  batt connected[/TH]
[TH]w/o batt connected[/TH]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>[/TD]
[TD][B]12.2 V rising to 12.7+ V[/B][/TD]
[TD]12.57 V steady[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL>[/TD]

[TD]0.4 V[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL>[/TD]
[TD]2.89 V[/TD]
[TD]2.98 V[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]<SIGNAL>SMC_CHGR_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL>[/TD]
[TD][B]0.05 V[/B][/TD]
[TD]0.05 V[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]Difference over <RESISTOR>R9398</RESISTOR> (GPU Phase 2)[/TD]
[TD]0 V >> 0 A draw[/TD]
[TD]0 V[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]Difference over <RESISTOR>R9399</RESISTOR> (GPU Phase 1)[/TD]
[TD]2.6 mV >> 3.5 A @0.85V >> ±3.0 W
(Miscalculated earlier)[/TD]
[TD]2.6 mV[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]Current draw from power supply[/TD]
[TD]2.25 A[/TD]
[TD]1.2 A[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]Difference over <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR> (BMON)[/TD]
[TD]-13 mV (w/o charger) >>  -2.6 A
8.5 mV (with charger) >> [B]1.7 A[/B][/TD]
[TD]0 mV[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]

The BMON isense does not seem to change when disconnecting the battery. I've replaced the cap and 3 resistors for battery Isensing, no change. <RESISTOR>R5423</RESISTOR> (between BMON and SMC) measures fine and is not shorted to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chime loop wich battery
threads.message:
With 1.7-2.6A through <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR>, <SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL> should be higher than 0.05V.
<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> gain for BMON is 36X.
2.6 x 0.005 x 36 = 0.468V which should get there.
Your problem could be <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, or SMC...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chime loop wich battery
threads.message:
So, I've been struggling with this one over the last few days.
* Replaced ISL > No change
* Replaced SMC > Didn't work (possibly faulty SMC)
* Replaced SMC with 3662 version and clean BIOS > Same behaviour (this one is just for testing, as I don't have any more 3787 donors)

I'm guessing some line gets overloaded, but not sure how to check this...
